Description: Pale red pottery vase of marl clay with drop-shaped body, small flat base, wide shoulder, short neck and rounded rim. Lower body scraped to trim.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kom el-Ahmar, Fort Cemetery Grave 157 (Hierakonpolis)
Curator's comments: Like 88h3 in Petrie’s Corpus of Proto-dynastic pottery (1953). Grave 157 in the Fort Cemetery was excavated by John Garstang and is published in in B. Adams, The Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis (1987), p. 161, where this pot is mis-identified as R57e
Acquisition name: Donated by: Frederick George Hilton Price
